metadata.Title: CVE-2021-39164 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description: Matrix is an ecosystem for open federated Instant Messaging and Voice overIP. In versions 1.41.0 and prior, unauthorised users can access themembership (list of members, with their display names) of a room if theyknow the ID of the room. The vulnerability is limited to rooms with`shared` history visibility. Furthermore, the unauthorised user must beusing an account on a vulnerable homeserver that is in the room. Serveradministrators should upgrade to 1.41.1 or later in order to receive thepatch. One workaround is available. Administrators of servers that use areverse proxy could, with potentially unacceptable loss of functionality,block the endpoints: `/_matrix/client/r0/rooms/{room_id}/members` with `at`query parameter, and `/_matrix/client/unstable/rooms/{room_id}/members`with `at` query parameter.

criterions.comment: matrix-synapse: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
